title: Font from wedding invitation
content:
I'm interested in finding out the name of the font used in the date(9.8.13) and the Mr. and Mrs. Robinson...

THANK YOU!!!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Wedding Invite.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405001044/http:/typophile.com/files/Wedding%20Invite.jpg) | 92.84 KB |
author: scraplete

comments.content:
M & P: Chevalier [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/chevalier/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405001044/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/chevalier/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/chevalier/")  
9.8.13: Sackers Gothic [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/sackers-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405001044/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/sackers-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/sackers-gothic/") Burin Sans [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/burin-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405001044/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/burin-sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/burin-sans/") Sweet Sans [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/sweet/sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405001044/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sweet/sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/sweet/sans/") or several other similar fonts  
Mr. and Mrs. Robinson are small and fuzzy but the letters and the ampersand seem consistent with Sackers Gothic, Burin Sans, or Sweet Sans. Don't think it makes a lot of difference which of these three you use for the these parts of the fonts.  
Don
AMAZING! Thank you!!! I do make an effort to try to figure it out myself but sometimes, I cannot! Thank you again!!!!
